rationale: HITRUST InfoSec Management Program (00.a) maps to NIST CSF 2.0 Govern Policy (GV.PO-01).
HITRUST Access Control Policy (01.a) maps to NIST Protect Access Control (PR.AC-01).
HITRUST User Registration (01.b) aligns with NIST Identity Management (PR.AA-01).
HITRUST Privilege Management (01.c) maps to NIST Access Permissions (PR.AA-05).
HITRUST Password Management (01.d) supports NIST Authenticator Management (PR.AA-03).
HITRUST Review of Access Rights (01.e) relates to NIST Identity Verification (PR.AA-04).
HITRUST Human Resources Security (03.a) maps to NIST Awareness and Training (PR.AT-01).
HITRUST Physical Security Perimeter (06.a) maps to NIST Physical Security (PR.PS-01).
HITRUST Encryption Control (09.s) maps to NIST Data-at-Rest Protection (PR.DS-01).
HITRUST Audit Logging (10.a) maps to NIST Detect Adverse Events (DE.AE-01).
HITRUST Incident Management (12.a) maps to NIST Respond Analysis (RS.MA-01).
HITRUST Business Continuity (14.a) maps to NIST Recover Planning (RC.RP-01).
HITRUST Risk Management (16.a) maps to NIST Identify Risk Assessment (ID.RA-01).
HITRUST Supplier Relationships (15.a) maps to NIST Govern Supply Chain (GV.SC-01).
